name.en: Freshman English as an Introduction to Science

notice.ch: 高級課程。限英文被分至高級者選修。不開放初選。

remark.ch: 高級課程。限英文被分至高級者選修。不開放初選。

goal.ch:
新制大一英文課程目標 CEFR B2 15 
Descriptors
Listening 聽力
1.能聽懂用標準口語所說的內容大意。
2.能在主題熟悉的情況下，了解大部分音檔和影片的重點。
3.能在講者陳述清晰的情況下，了解個人專業領域內的課程或演講。

SPEAKING - Spoken Production 口語發表
4.能在事先準備的情況下，就感興趣的主題進行發表，並詳盡描述內容。
5.能透過提出論點、利弊、或因果關係等方法，來表達對一個議題的看法。

SPEAKING - Spoken Interaction 口語互動
6.能以一定的流暢度、自然地進行口語互動。
7.能在努力投入的情況下，跟上並參與小組討論。

READING 閱讀
8.能快速瀏覽長篇複雜文本並掌握所需的細節。
9.能搜尋和瀏覽多個資料出處以獲取相關資訊。
10.能理解個人專業領域或感興趣主題的文本大意。
11.能了解文章作者的觀點。

WRITING寫作
12.能寫出拼字和標點符號用法正確的文章。
13.能寫出描述清楚、提供細節的文章。
14.能寫出結合多個來源想法的文章。
15.能寫出清楚的理由來支持自己的論點。
goal.en:
CEFR B2 15 Descriptors
Listening
1. I can understand the main ideas of what is    said to me in standard spoken English. 
2. I can understand the main ideas of most      audios and videos of familiar topics.
3. I can follow a lecture or talk within my own    
 field if the presentation is clear.

SPEAKING - Spoken Production
4. I can give a clear, prepared presentation      about topics I am interested in and provide      etailed descriptions.
5. I can express my opinion on an issue by      giving reasons, talking about the advantages   
 and disadvantages, or analyzing cause and effect.

SPEAKING - Spoken Interaction
6. I can interact quite fluently and naturally in   
 conversations.
7. I can, with some effort, keep up with and      contribute to group discussions.

READING
8. I can scan quickly through long and complex texts and find the details I want.
9. I can search and browse various sources to obtain relevant information.
10. I can understand the main ideas of reading materials within my field of study or of my          interest.
11. I can understand the writer’s point of view  when reading an article.

WRITING
12. I can write an essay with reasonably          
     accurate spelling and punctuation.
13. I can write an essay with clear descriptions and proper details.
14. I can write an essay combining the ideas    from multiple sources.
15. I can write an essay giving reasons to        
    support my point of view.

outline.ch:
Week 1: Introduction to the Course and Expectations
Topics:Overview of course objectives
Explanation of expectations and assessments
Week 2: Unit 2 - Behavioral Science
Topic: Generation Z
Reading Skill: Annotating
Listening Skill: Identifying details
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 3: Unit 2 - Behavioral Science
Topic: This is why you are addicted to your phone
Reading Skill: Annotating
Note-taking Skill: Taking notes to compare and contrast
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 4: Unit 2 - Behavioral Science
Topic: Predictive Advertising
Activities:
Watch the unit video
Critical Thinking Strategy: Discussing ideas and restating information
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 5: Seminars
Week 6: Unit 3 - Developmental Psychology
Topic: The difference between fitting in and belonging
Reading Skill: Making inferences
Listening Skill: Making predictions
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 7: Unit 3 - Developmental Psychology
Topic: Life lessons I learned from my Dad in 23 years
Reading Skill: Making inferences
Note-taking Skill: Taking notes using keywords and phrases
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 8: Unit 3 - Developmental Psychology
Topic: Why do children want to quit?
Activities:
Watch the unit video
Critical Thinking Strategy: Relating course materials to personal experience
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 9: Midterm Assessment and Presentation
Week 10: Seminars
Week 11: Unit 4 - Science and Technology
Topic: Five innovative technologies that bring energy to the developing world
Reading Skill: Using T-chart to compare and contrast
Listening Skill: Making inferences
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 12: Unit 4 - Science and Technology
Topic: This device pulls water out of desert air
Reading Skill: Using T-chart to compare and contrast
Note-taking Skill: Using a split page
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 13: Unit 4 - Science and Technology
Topic: Inventions to save the planet
Activities:
Watch the unit video
Critical Thinking Strategy: Categorizing information
Weekly Input: Science-related topics decided by each study group
Weekly Output: Oral presentation, written production, etc.
Week 14: Unit 4 - Science and Technology
Topic: Moore’s Law
Activities:
Watch the unit video
Critical Thinking Strategy: Categorizing information
Output: Oral presentations
Week 15: Seminars
Week 16: Oral Presentations
Week 17: Revision
Week 18: Final Exam

textbook.ch:
Required: 
Daise, D., ＆ Norloff, C. (2020). Q: Skills for Success Reading and Writing 4 (3rd ed.). Oxford University Press.

Recommended Science News Websites:
1. Scientific American: Science News, Expert Analysis, Health Research
https://www.scientificamerican.com/
2.        Deutsche Welle News: In-depth reporting on science and technology
https://www.dw.com/en/top-stories/science/s-12526
3.        NASA: Climate Change and Global Warming https://climate.nasa.gov/
4.        Science News for Students
https://www.sciencenewsforstudents.org/
5.        BBC Science and Environment
https://www.bbc.com/news/science_and_environment
6.        Guardian Science https://www.theguardian.com/science 
7.        Guardian Tech  https://www.theguardian.com/uk/technology
8.        Popular Science https://www.popsci.com/science/
9.        https://earthsky.org/
10.     60 second science 
https://www.scientificamerican.com/podcast/60-second-science/
11.     Kurzgesagt – In a Nutshell
         https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsXVk37bltHxD1rDPwtNM8Q

en: Department:Department of Mathematics、Department of Physics、Department of Chemistry、Department of Optics and Photonics、Joint Science Program、Department of Life Sciences only.Year:First Year only.
